title: 820-3435 1V PPbus
message:
This mac had short C7131, I replaced it but with no result.
Replaced Q7130, U7100, AND Q7180.
When I removed F7140, there is no voltage on either side.

PP3v4_g3h 3,4; PPbus ~0,92V;  PPDCIN 16,65V

title: 820-3435 1V PPbus
message: What is the actual voltage at C7131?

title: 820-3435 1V PPbus
message:
Now post Q7180 voltages.
Use R7180/85 ast test points.

title: 820-3435 1V PPbus
message:
Change Q7180, is bad.
Be sure no short to ground at R7120.

title: 820-3435 1V PPbus
message:
replaces it, same result.
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 79357, member: 682"]
Certifique-se de que não haja curto para o aterramento em R7120.
[/QUOTE]
There is no short.

title: 820-3435 1V PPbus
message:
Did you check the trace between R7120 and Q7180?

"2-16,68V
---------------
3- 6,77 V"
Do you know how a MOSFET P-channel works???
Because these readings imply to get same pin 2 voltage into pin 4.
Please check again and be sure to post accurate information.
